properties.Summary: Kevin Janson Neal, 44, went on an approximately 45-minute shooting spree in the rural community of Rancho Tehama Reserve in Northern California, including shooting up an elementary school, before being killed by law enforcement officers. Neal had also killed his wife at home.
properties.Where obtained: TBD
properties.Weapon details: Two illegally modified rifles

properties.Summary: Devin Patrick Kelley, a 26-year-old ex-US Air Force airman, opened fire at the First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs during Sunday morning services, killing at least 26 people and wounding and injuring 20 others. He left the church and fled in his vehicle after engaging in a gunfight with a local citizen; he soon crashed his vehicle and died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
properties.Mental health - details: Kelley had a history of domestic violence, including a court martial and conviction stemming from assaulting his wife and child; he also had a history of cruelty to animals and of stalking and harassing ex-girlfriends, including an underage girl. He reportedly briefly escaped from a mental health facility in 2012.
properties.Weapons obtained legally: Kelley passed federal criminal background checks; the US Air Force failed to provide information on his criminal history to the FBI
properties.Where obtained: Purchased in April 2016 from an Academy Sports & Outdoors store in San Antonio
properties.Weapon details: Ruger AR-556; Kelley also possessed semiautomatic handguns

properties.Summary: Scott Allen Ostrem, 47, walked into a Walmart in a suburb north of Denver and fatally shot two men and a woman, then left the store and drove away. After an all-night manhunt, Ostrem, who had financial problems but no serious criminal history, was captured by police after being spotted near his apartment in Denver.

Radee Labeeb Prince, 37, fatally shot three people and wounded two others around 9am at Advance Granite Solutions, a home remodeling business where he worked near Baltimore. Hours later he shot and wounded a sixth person at a car dealership in Wilmington, Delaware. He was apprehended that evening following a manhunt by authorities.
properties.Where obtained: Unclear
properties.Weapon details: .380-caliber; make unclear

properties.Summary: Stephen Craig Paddock, 64, rained a barrage of rapid gunfire down on thousands of concertgoers on the Las Vegas Strip late on a Sunday night, firing from a corner suite on the 32nd floor of the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino. Soon thereafter, he was found by law enforcement inside the hotel room, deceased from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
properties.Mental health - details: Perpetrator's history unclear. In 1969 Paddock's father was classified by the FBI as a dangerous psychopath with suicidal tendencies; psychopathy can be heritable (see Mother Jones sourcing).
properties.Where obtained: Two gun shops in Nevada
properties.Type of weapons: 23 firearms, mostly rifles; including scopes, and two modified for "fully automatic" firing; two were mounted on tripods
properties.Weapon details: AR-15-style and AK-47-style rifles and "a large cache of ammunition"; four Daniel Defense DDM4 rifles, three FN-15s and other rifles made by Sig Sauer.

properties.Summary: Jimmy Lam, 38, fatally shot three coworkers and wounded two others inside a UPS facility in San Francisco. Lam killed himself as law enforcement officers responded to the scene.
properties.Mental health - details: Lam had a history of domestic, work conflict
properties.Where obtained: Unclear; the firearm was stolen in Utah. A second handgun Lam had (also stolen) was unused in the attack.
properties.Weapon details: MAC-10-style “assault pistol”; 30-round magazine. An additional box of ammunition.

properties.Summary: Randy Stair, a 24-year-old worker at Weis grocery fatally shot three of his fellow employees. He reportedly fired 59 rounds with a pair of shotguns before turning the gun on himself as another co-worker fled the scene for help and law enforcement responded.

John Robert Neumann, Jr., 45, a former employee of manufacturer Fiamma Inc. fatally shot five workers at the company, and then killed himself on the scene. He'd been fired from the company in April. The attack took place a week before the one-year anniversary of the Orlando nightclub massacre.

Thomas Hartless, 43, shot and killed a former girlfriend and another employee of a nursing home, and then fatally shot the Kirkersville police chief responding to the scene. Hartless' former girlfriend had recently obtained a court protection order against Hartless. Investigators later found more than 60 firearms in the home of Hartless, who was also found dead at the scene of the attack.
properties.Mental health - details: Hartless had a violent criminal history; his former girlfriend had submitted a letter in court recently stating that he had "a severe mental disorder."

properties.Summary: Kori Ali Muhammad, 39, opened fire along a street in downtown Fresno, killing three people randomly in an alleged hate crime prior to being apprehended by police. Muhammad, who is black, killed three white victims and later described his attack as being racially motivated; he also reportedly yelled 'Allahu Akbar' at the time he was arrested, but authorities indicated they found no links to Islamist terrorism.
properties.Weapon details: .357 revolver

properties.Summary: Esteban Santiago, 26, flew from Alaska to Fort Lauderdale, where he opened fire in the baggage claim area of the airport, killing five and wounding six before police aprehended him.
properties.Total victims: 11 (dozens more were reportedly injured in the panic)
properties.Mental health - details: Among other signs, Santiago had gone to a FBI office in Anchorage and complained that his mind was being controlled by the CIA.
properties.Weapon details: Walther 9mm semi-automatic pistol[

properties.Summary: Arcan Cetin, 20, killed a teen girl and three women in the cosmetics section of a Macy’s department store at the Cascade Mall. A man was critically wounded in the shooting and taken to Harborview Medical Center in Seattle, where he died. Cetin was apprehended by police a few hours after the shooting while driving a car near his residence.
properties.Mental health - details: According to the Cetin's stepfather he had "mental health issues"; court records showed that he suffered from anxiety and depression.

properties.Summary: Gavin Long, a former Marine who served in Iraq, killed three police offers responding to a 911 call, and wounded three others. He was killed in a shoot-out with other officers responding to the scene. Prior to the attack, Long posted prolifically on social media, where he expressed admiration for the cop killer in Dallas 10 days prior.
properties.Mental health - details: Unclear
properties.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic rifles; one semiautomatic handgun
properties.Weapon details: IWI Tavor SAR 5.56 caliber rifle, Springfield XD 9, 9mm

properties.Summary: Micah Xavier Johnson, a 25-year-old Army veteran, targeted police at a peaceful Black Lives Matter protest, killing five officers and injuring nine others as well as two civilians. After a prolonged standoff in a downtown building, law enforcement killed Johnson using a robot-delivered bomb.
properties.Mental health - details: Unclear
properties.Where obtained: online and or gun show
properties.Weapon details: Izhmash-Saiga 5.45mm (AK-style) semiautomatic rifle with large capacity magazines; Glock 9mm handgun, .25-caliber semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Omar Mateen, 29, attacked the Pulse nighclub in Orlando in the early morning hours of June 12. He was killed by law enforcement who raided the club after a prolonged standoff.
properties.Mental health - details: Unclear
properties.Where obtained: Shooting center in Port St. Lucie, Florida
properties.Weapon details: Sig Sauer MCX rifle, Glock 17 9mm; high-capacity magazines (30 rounds)

properties.Summary: Cedric L. Ford, who worked as a painter at a manufacturing company, shot victims from his car and at his workplace before being killed by police at the scene. Shortly before the rampage he had been served with a restraining order.
properties.Mental health - details: Unclear
properties.Weapon details: Zastava Serbia AK-47-style rifle, Glock Model 22 .40-caliber handgun; high-capacity magazines (30 rounds)

properties.Summary: Jason B. Dalton, a driver for Uber, apparently selected his victims randomly as he went on a rampage over several hours in three different locations, including five people he shot in the parking lot of a Cracker Barrel restaurant. He was "arrested without incident" at a downtown Kalamazoo bar about six hours after the rampage began.
properties.Mental health - details: Unclear
properties.Weapon details: 9 mm handgun (ammo used unclear)

properties.Summary: Syed Rizwan Farook left a Christmas party held at Inland Regional Center, later returning with Tashfeen Malik and the two opened fire, killing 14 and wounding 21, ten critically. The two were later killed by police as they fled in an SUV.
properties.Mental health - details: Unclear
properties.Where obtained: The suspects purchased their handguns in the United States; the assault rifles were purchased by a third party.
properties.Type of weapons: Two assault rifles and two semi-automatic pistols were used in the attack. Police found a remote controlled explosive device at the scene of the crime. At the home were 12 pipe bombs, 2,500 rounds for the AR-15 variants, 2,000 rounds for the pistols, and several hundred for a .22 calibre rifle. In the suspects' car were an additional 1,400 rounds for the rifles and 200 for the handguns.
properties.Weapon details: Two semiautomatic AR-15-style rifles—one a DPMS A-15, the other a Smith & Wesson M&P15, both with .223 calibre ammunition. Two 9mm semiautomatic handguns. High capacity magazines.

properties.Summary: Robert Lewis Dear, 57, shot and killed a police officer and two citizens when he opened fire at a Planned Parenthood health clinic in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Nine others were wounded. Dear was arrested after an hours-long standoff with police.
properties.Mental health - details: The judge in the case has not publicly released Dear's medical and mental health records. As of April 5, 2016, Dear was undergoing a competency evaluation. Dear had a history of disputes with his relatives and neighbors. At a hearing in December 2015, he said, "I am a warrior for the babies."
properties.Where obtained: Unclear
properties.Weapon details: Reportedly an AK-47 style semiautomatic rifle and others. Authorities had not released details on Dear's weapons as of April 2016.

properties.Summary: Noah Harpham, 33, shot three people before dead in Colorado Springs before police killed him in a shootout.
properties.Mental health - details: Prior to the rampage, Harpham wrote an "incoherent" blog and rambled "nonsensically" in a YouTube video about mind control techniques and God, according to the Denver Post. He had a history of drug and alcohol abuse.
properties.Where obtained: Unclear
properties.Weapon details: AR-15 rifle, a 9 mm pistol, and a .357 revolver

properties.Summary: 26-year-old Chris Harper Mercer opened fire at Umpqua Community College in southwest Oregon. The gunman shot himself to death after being wounded in a shootout with police.
properties.Mental health - details: Harper-Mercer's mother said in multiple online postings that he had Asperger's syndrome. Harper-Mercer graduated from the Switzer Learning Center, a school for students with special needs, emotional difficulties, autism and Asperger's syndrome.
properties.Where obtained: From the home he shared with his mother. All were legally obtained by either Harper/Mercer or family members.
properties.Type of weapons: Five pistols, one rifle, five magazines of ammunition
properties.Weapon details: 9 mm Glock pistol, .40 caliber Smith & Wesson, .40 caliber Taurus pistol, .556 caliber Del-Ton; (ammo details unclear)

properties.Summary: Kuwaiti-born Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez, 24, a naturalized US citizen, opened fire at a Naval reserve center, and then drove to a military recruitment office where he shot and killed four Marines and a Navy service member, and wounded a police officer and another military service member. He was then fatally shot in an exchange of gunfire with law enforcement officers responding to the attack.
properties.Mental health - details: Abdulazeez "had suffered for years from depression and possibly from bipolar disorder," according to a representative of the family. (NYT, July 20 2015)
properties.Weapons obtained legally: Yes ("some of the weapons were purchased legally and some of them may not have been")
properties.Where obtained: On the internet, via Armslist.com
properties.Weapon details: AK-47, AR-15, and 30-round magazines; 9mm handgun

properties.Summary: Dylann Storm Roof, 21, shot and killed 9 people after opening fire at the Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, South Carolina. According to a roommate, he had allegedly been “planning something like that for six months."
properties.Where obtained: Shooter's Choice gun store in West Columbia, South Carolina
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber Glock (model 41, with 13-round capacity magazine)

properties.Summary: Sergio Valencia del Toro, 27, in what officials say was a random act, shot and killed three people including an 11-year-old girl before turning the gun on himself.
properties.Mental health - details: While serving in the Air Force, he went to an emergency walk-in clinic because of concerns over his mood swings, and had either sought or been ordered to behavioral health interventions, according to Fox 6 Now. In a 2014 risk assessment with a psychologist at an outpatient clinic in Appleton, Valencia del Toro recalled thinking previously: "If I'm gonna take myself out, I might as well take other people with me." The police report obtained by Fox 6 says that Valencia del Toro had a history of depression, suicidal and occassionally homicidal thoughts, and alcoholism. He was intoxicated on the day of the shooting.
properties.Where obtained: Unclear
properties.Weapon details: Details unclear, but after the shooting, police found eight guns in total in Valencia del Toro's home, including handguns, shotguns, and rifles, plus and more than 1,000 rounds of ammunition. He took two weapons and ammunition to the bridge.

properties.Summary:
Jaylen Fryberg, 15, using a .40-caliber Berretta, shot five 
students at Marysville High School, including two of his cousins and three friends, killing all but one. Fryberg arranged to meet them for lunch in the school cafeteria by text. Fryberg was reportedly well-liked at the school and there was not believed to be any ill-will between him and his victims. He committed suicide at the scene.
properties.Mental health - details: Fryberg was well-liked and allegedly happy, but was also upset about a girl and had posted emotional social media messages. No definitive signs of mental health problems.
properties.Where obtained: Gun was his father's.
properties.Weapon details: Beretta .40-caliber handgun

properties.Summary: Elliot Rodger, 22, shot three people to death in the college town of Isla Vista near the University of California, Santa Barbara. He also shot others as he drove around town, and injured others by striking them with is vehicle. He committed suicide by shooting himself in his car as police closed in. Prior to the rampage, Rodger stabbed three people to death at his apartment.
properties.Mental health - details: Rodger was never hospitalized due to mental illness, but had a long history of mental health issues dating back to his childhood, and received treatment from multiple counselors leading up to his rampage. According to The Independent, Rodger had considered suicide but had no history of violence. Just before his rampage, he sent a 137-page manifesto to multiple people.
properties.Type of weapons: Three semi-automatic handguns and two hunting knives
properties.Weapon details: Two Sig Sauer P226 semiautomatic pistols and Glock 34 pistol, and hundreds of rounds of ammo. A 6- inchand 8-inch “SRK” and “Boar Hunter” hunting knives.

properties.Summary: Army Specialist Ivan Lopez, 34, opened fire at the Fort Hood Army Post in Texas, killing three and wounding at least 12 others before shooting himself in the head after engaging with military police. Lt. Gen. Mark A. Milley told reporters that Lopez "had behavioral health and mental health" issues.
properties.Mental health - details: Lopez "had a long history of troubling behavior," according to the Washington Post, including a history of decieving others, problems in his personal life, and financial difficulties. However, officials found that Lopez exhibited no signals that he could be violent. In the year leading up to the attack, he sought treatment for medical and behavioral health ailments.
properties.Where obtained: Local gun store in Killeen, Guns Galore
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber Smith & Wesson handgun

properties.Summary: Cherie Lash Rhoades, 44, opened fire at the Cedarville Rancheria Tribal Office and Community Center, killing four and wounding two. After running out of ammunition, Rhoades grabbed a butcher knife and stabbed another person.
properties.Type of weapons: Two handguns and a butcher knife
properties.Weapon details: 9mm semi-automatic handgun

properties.Summary: Aaron Alexis, 34, a military veteran and contractor from Texas, opened fire in the Navy installation, killing 12 people and wounding 8 before being shot dead by police.
properties.Mental health - details: Had told Rhode Island police the prior month that he'd "heard voices"; had been undergoing mental health treatment with Veterans Affairs since August 2013.
properties.Where obtained: Sharpshooters Small Arms Range
properties.Type of weapons: Sawed-off shotgun, 2 boxes of shells; also a .45-caliber handgun taken from a security guard he shot at the scene.
properties.Weapon details: Remington 870 Express 12-gauge shotgun; Beretta handgun

properties.Summary: Pedro Vargas, 42, set fire to his apartment, killed six people in the complex, and held another two hostages at gunpoint before a SWAT team stormed the building and fatally shot him.
properties.Mental health - details: His mother told authorities her son had been acting strangely and needed a psychiatric evaluation.
properties.Where obtained: Florida Gun Center
properties.Weapon details: Glock 17

properties.Summary: John Zawahri, 23, armed with a homemade assault rifle and high-capacity magazines, killed his brother and father at home and then headed to Santa Monica College, where he was eventually killed by police.
properties.Mental health - details: He was known as a solitary teen who regularly ditched class and had an interest in assault weapons; he had been admitted to UCLA's psychiatric ward for a brief period.
properties.Where obtained: Assembled a rifle out of component parts.
properties.Type of weapons: Assault rifle, high capacity magazines, antique handgun
properties.Weapon details: .223-caliber semi-automatic assault rifle, about 40 high capacity magazines, "black powder" handgun (likely antique)

properties.Summary: Dennis Clark III, 27, shot and killed his girlfriend in their shared apartment, and then shot two witnesses in the building's parking lot and a third victim in another apartment, before being killed by police.
properties.Where obtained: Unknown
properties.Weapon details: .40 caliber semi-automatic handgun, pistol grip shotgun

properties.Summary: Kurt Myers, 64, shot six people in neighboring towns, killing two in a barbershop and two at a car care business, before being killed by officers in a shootout after a nearly 19-hour standoff.
properties.Where obtained: Frank's Guns in Marcy, NY
properties.Weapon details: Unknown

properties.Summary: Adam Lanza, 20, shot his mother dead at their home then drove to Sandy Hook Elementary school. He forced his way inside and opened fire, killing 20 children and six adults before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: Lanza had a history of serious mental health problems that were known to his family and others, as detailed in a post-massacre investigation by Connecticut authorities.
properties.Where obtained: Stolen from mother
properties.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun (assault)
properties.Weapon details: 10mm Glock, 9mm SIG Sauer P226 semiautomatic handguns; .223 Bushmaster XM15-E2S semiautomatic rifle; Izhmash Saiga-12 12-gauge semiautomatic shotgun

properties.Summary: Andrew Engeldinger, 36, upon learning he was being fired, went on a shooting rampage, killing the business owner, three fellow employees, and a UPS driver. He then killed himself.
properties.Mental health - details: His family worried about his "paranoia and delusions" for at least two years prior, and tried to get him to seek treatment.
properties.Where obtained: Unknown
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Glock semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: U.S. Army veteran Wade Michael Page, 40, opened fire in a Sikh gurdwara before he died from a self-inflicted gunshot would during a shootout with police.
properties.Mental health - details: His Army friends once broke into his apartment, fearing he'd commit suicide in the '90s. A psychiatric nurse who lived downstairs from Page said it was "obvious" he had a mental illness.
properties.Where obtained: Unknown
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Springfield Armory XDM semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: James Holmes, 24, opened fire in a movie theater during the opening night of "The Dark Night Rises" and was later arrested outside.
properties.Mental health - details: He saw at least three mental health professionals before dropping out of his university.
properties.Where obtained: Gander Mountain stores in Thornton and Aurora, Colo.; Bass Pro Shop in Denver, Colo.; BulkAmmo.com
properties.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun
properties.Weapon details: Two .40-caliber Glock semiautomatic handguns; .223-caliber Smith & Wesson M&P15 semiautomatic rifle; 12-gauge Remington 870 pump-action shotgun

properties.Summary: Ian Stawicki, 40, gunned down four patrons at a cafe, and another person during a carjacking nearby, then shot himself as police closed in. (He died later that day in a Seattle hospital.)
properties.Mental health - details: His family said he was mentally ill
properties.Where obtained: Bull's Eye Shooter Supply in Tacoma, Wash.
properties.Weapon details: Two .45-caliber semiautomatic handguns

properties.Summary: One L. Goh, 43, a former student, opened fire in a nursing classroom. He fled the scene by car and was arrested nearby a few hours later.
properties.Mental health - details: A former instructor at Oikos described him as "mentally unstable" and "paranoid."
properties.Where obtained: Bullseye in Castro Valley, Calif.
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Jeong Soo Paek, 59, returned to a Korean spa from which he'd been kicked out after an altercation. He gunned down two of his sisters and their husbands before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: His sister worried about his homicidal tendencies; she said his mental health had been deteriorating and that he had threatened to commit suicide with his gun.
properties.Where obtained: Unknown
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Scott Evans Dekraai, 42, opened fire inside a hair salon and was later arrested.
properties.Mental health - details: He suffered from bipolar disorder, mood swings, and PTSD.
properties.Where obtained: Unknown
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber Heckler & Koch, 9mm Springfield semiautomatic handguns; .44 Magnum Smith & Wesson revolver

properties.Summary: Eduardo Sencion, 32, opened fire at an International House of Pancakes restaurant and later died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
properties.Mental health - details: He was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia as a teenager and feared demons were out to get him.
properties.Where obtained: Purchased from an individual
properties.Weapon details: AK-47 Norinco Arms variant, AK-47 Romarm Cugir variant rifles; .38-caliber Colt revolver

properties.Summary: Jared Loughner, 22, opened fire outside a Safeway during a constituent meeting with Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords (D-Ariz.) before he was subdued by bystanders and arrested.
properties.Mental health - details: His symptoms pointed to various possible mental illness diagnoses, such as schizophrenia and delusional disorder. He also experimented with pot and hallucinogens.
properties.Where obtained: Sportsmen's Warehouse in Tucson, Ariz.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Glock 19 semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Omar S. Thornton, 34, shot up his Hartford Beer Distributor workplace after facing disciplinary issues, then committed suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: He apparently was driven over the edge by unaddressed, ongoing racism against him at work
properties.Where obtained: Gun dealer in East Windsor, Conn.
properties.Weapon details: Two 9mm Ruger SR9 semiautomatic handguns

properties.Summary: Maurice Clemmons, 37, a felon who was out on bail for child-rape charges, entered a coffee shop on a Sunday morning and shot four police officers who had gone there to use their laptops before their shifts. Clemmons, who was wounded fleeing the scene, was later shot dead by a police officer in Seattle after a two-day manhunt.
properties.Mental health - details: He had a history of erratic, bizarre behavior. He once asked his family to get naked for 5 minutes on Sunday; he said he thought the world would end and that he was Jesus.
properties.Where obtained: Stolen from an individual in Seattle.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Glock 17 semiautomatic handgun; .38-caliber Smith & Wesson revolver

properties.Summary: Army psychiatrist Nidal Malik Hasan, 39, opened fire on an Army base in an attack linked to Islamist extremism. Hasan was injured during the attack and later arrested.
properties.Mental health - details: Medical officials at Walter Reed Army Medical Center and the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences raised concerns prior to the shooting regarding Hasan's aloof and erratic behavior and extremist Islamic views.
properties.Where obtained: Guns Galore in Kileen, Texas
properties.Weapon details: FN Five-seven semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Jiverly Wong, 41, opened fire at an American Civic Association center for immigrants before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: He apparently harbored growing paranoia toward cops. He also sent a delusional letter to a local TV station right before the shooting.
properties.Where obtained: Gander Mountain in Johnson City, N.Y.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Beretta, .45-caliber Springfield semiautomatic handguns

properties.Summary: Robert Stewart, 45, opened fire at a nursing home where his estranged wife worked before he was shot and arrested by a police officer.
properties.Mental health - details: His estranged wife told her workplace that her husband had an "unstable mental state or (was) mentally ill."
properties.Where obtained: Local sporting goods stores and individuals
properties.Weapon details: Winchester 1300 pump-action shotgun; .357 Magnum revolver

properties.Summary: Disgruntled employee Wesley Neal Higdon, 25, shot up an Atlantis Plastics factory after he was escorted out of his workplace for an argument with a supervisor. Higdon shot the supervisor outside the factory before opening fire on coworkers inside. He then committed suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: He called his girlfriend two hours before the shooting to say he was going to kill his boss.
properties.Where obtained: Unknown
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber Hi-Point semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Steven Kazmierczak, 27, opened fire in a lecture hall, then shot and killed himself before police arrived.
properties.Mental health - details: He had a long history of mental health struggles; after high school, his parents placed him at a psychiatric treatment center. He told friends he left the Army after six months due to a psychological discharge.
properties.Where obtained: Online and gun retailers in Champaign, Ill.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Glock 19, Hi-Point CF380, 9mm Kurz SIG Sauer P232 semiautomatic handguns; 12-gauge Remington Sportsman 48 sawed-off shotgun

properties.Summary: Charles "Cookie" Lee Thornton, 52, went on a rampage at the city hall before being shot and killed by police.
properties.Mental health - details: He was known for histrionics and disruptions at city council meetings. His mounting debt was a stressor.
properties.Where obtained: Taken in burglary and from fallen police officer
properties.Weapon details: .40-caliber Smith & Wesson semiautomatic handgun; .44 Magnum Smith & Wesson Model 29 revolver

properties.Summary: Robert A. Hawkins, 19, opened fire inside Westroads Mall before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: He had been treated in the past for depression and ADHD.
properties.Where obtained: Stolen from grandfather
properties.Weapon details: WASR-10 Century Arms semiautomatic rifle

properties.Summary: Off-duty sheriff's deputy Tyler Peterson, 20, opened fire inside an apartment after an argument at a homecoming party. He fled the scene and later committed suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: The families of victims filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the county arguing that the police department should have evaluated the gunman's mental health before hiring him.
properties.Where obtained: Issued by Forest County Sheriff's Department
properties.Weapon details: AR-15 SWAT semiautomatic rifle

properties.Summary: Virginia Tech student Seung-Hui Cho, 23, opened fire on his school's campus before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: A district court ruled Cho was "an imminent danger" to himself and others as a result of mental illness two years earlier, and directed Cho to seek treatment.
properties.Where obtained: Purchased variously online and from Roanoke Firearms in Roanoke, Va.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Glock 19, .22-caliber Walther P22 semiautomatic handguns

properties.Summary: Sulejman Talović, 18, rampaged through the shopping center until he was shot dead by police.
properties.Mental health - details: According to one relative, he was violent and had the mental capacity of a child. (But accounts from others did not indicate this about the shooter.)
properties.Where obtained: Purchased variously from Sportsman's Fast Cash in West Valley City, Utah and individuals
properties.Weapon details: Mossberg Maverick 88 Field shotgun; .38-caliber Smith & Wesson M36 revolver

properties.Summary: Charles Carl Roberts, 32, shot 10 young girls in a one-room schoolhouse in Bart Township, killing 5, before taking his own life.
properties.Mental health - details: He told his wife that he'd molested two young relatives 20 years ago.
properties.Where obtained: Local stores in Nickel Mines, Penn.
properties.Type of weapons: One semiautomatic handgun, one rifle, one shotgun
properties.Weapon details: Springfield semiautomatic handgun; .30-06 Ruger bolt-action rifle; 12-gauge Browning pump-action shotgun

properties.Summary: Kyle Aaron Huff, 28, opened fire at a rave afterparty in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Seattle before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: Police were unable to find any record that he had been treated for mental illness or was on psychiatric medication.
properties.Where obtained: Various sporting goods stores in Kalispell, Mont.
properties.Type of weapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun
properties.Weapon details: .40-caliber Ruger, one other semiautomatic handgun; Bushmaster XM15 E2S semiautomatic rifle; 12-gauge Winchester Defender pump-action shotgun with extended tube and pistol grip

properties.Summary: Former postal worker Jennifer Sanmarco, 44, shot dead a former neighbor then drove to the mail processing plant where she used to work. Inside, she opened fire, killing six employees before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: She was placed on retirement disability for psychological reasons. Fellow employees described her behavior as increasingly bizarre. She believed the Postal Service employees were conspiring against her.
properties.Where obtained: Pawn shops in Grants and Gallup, N.M.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Smith & Wesson 915 semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Jeffrey Weise, 16, murdered his grandfather, who was a police officer, and grandfather's girlfriend. Weise then drove his grandfather's squad car to Red Lake Senior High School and opened fire on the reservation campus, killing another seven people before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: He voluntarily visited a a psychiatric ward. He was hospitalized at least once for suicidal tendencies and was taking Prozac.
properties.Where obtained: Glock and Remington stolen from grandfather
properties.Weapon details: .40-caliber Glock 23, .22-caliber Ruger semiautomatic handguns; 12-gauge Remington 870 shotgun

properties.Summary: Living Church of God member Terry Michael Ratzmann, 44, opened fire at a church meeting at a Sheraton hotel before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: Neighbors said he suffered from depression and had a drinking problem.
properties.Where obtained: Gun dealer in Waukesha, Wis.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Beretta semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Nathan Gale, 25, possibly upset about the breakup of Pantera, gunned down former Pantera guitarist Dimebag Darrell and three others at a Damageplan show before a police officer fatally shot Gale.
properties.Mental health - details: He was discharged from the military because he was a paranoid schizophrenic.
properties.Where obtained: Received as a gift from mother
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Beretta 92FS semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Assembly line worker Douglas Williams, 48, opened fire at his Lockheed Martin workplace in a racially motivated attack before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: His cousin said he was depressed and "going through a lot of things."
properties.Where obtained: Purchased from an individual
properties.Type of weapons: One semiautomatic handgun, two rifles, one derringer, one shotgun
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber Ruger P90 semiautomatic handgun; .22-caliber rifle with scope, .223-caliber Ruger Mini-14 rifle; 12-gauge Winchester 1300 shotgun; .22 Magnum derringer

properties.Summary: Fired employee William D. Baker, 66, opened fire at his former Navistar workplace before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: He had a criminal past, including a sexual assault conviction.
properties.Where obtained: Some purchased from Pepper Sports in Glen Ellyn, Ill.
properties.Type of weapons: Two rifles, one revolver, one shotgun
properties.Weapon details: SKS 1954R, .30-caliber Winchester rifles; 12-gauge Remington pump-action shotgun; .38-caliber revolver

properties.Summary: Michael McDermott, 42, opened fire on co-workers at Edgewater Technology and was later arrested.
properties.Mental health - details: Psychiatrist guessed he had schizophrenia, but McDermott had researched how to fake a mental illness on the internet. Defense lawyer described history of suicide attempts and mental illness dating back to teen years. Jury rejected his insanity defense.
properties.Where obtained: Unknown
properties.Type of weapons: One semiautomatic handgun, one rifle (assault), one shotgun
properties.Weapon details: .32-caliber Retolaza semiautomatic handgun; AK-47 variant semiautomatic rifle; 12-gauge Winchester 1300 pump-action shotgun

properties.Summary: Hotel employee Silvio Leyva, 36, gunned down four coworkers at the Radisson Bay Harbor Inn before killing a woman outside who refused to give him her car. He was arrested shortly after the shootings.
properties.Mental health - details: His brother called him "unbalanced" and mentally ill.
properties.Where obtained: One purchased from Big E's in Tampa, Fla.
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Lorcin semiautomatic handgun; .38-caliber Charter Arms revolver

properties.Summary: Byran Koji Uyesugi, 40, a Xerox service technician, opened fire inside the building with a 9mm Glock. He fled and was later apprehended by police.
properties.Mental health - details: A psychiatrist, testifying for the prosecution,said he suffered from schizophrenia.
properties.Where obtained: Hunting Supplies of Hawaii (The Armory) in Honolulu, Hawaii
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Glock 17 semiautomatic handgun

properties.Summary: Larry Gene Ashbrook, 47, opened fire inside the Wedgwood Baptist Church during a prayer rally before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: His siblings decribed him as a paranoid schizophrenic.
properties.Where obtained: Trader's Village flea market in Grand Prairie, Texas
properties.Weapon details: .380-caliber, 9mm Ruger P85 semiautomatic handguns

properties.Summary: Day trader Mark O. Barton, 44, who had recently lost a substantial sum of money, went on a shooting spree through two day-trading firms. He started at the All-Tech Investment Group, where he worked, then went on to Momentum Securities. He fled and hours later, after being cornered by police outside a gas station, committed suicide. (Two days before the spree, he killed his wife and two children with a hammer.)
properties.Mental health - details: In letters, he details his deep depression and downward spiral.
properties.Where obtained: Glock purchased from gun store in Warner Robins, Ga.
properties.Weapon details: .45-caliber Colt 1911-A1, 9mm Glock 17, .25-caliber Raven Arms MP-25 semiautomatic handguns; .22-caliber Harrington & Richardson revolver

properties.Summary: Eric Harris, 18, and Dylan Klebold, 17, opened fire throughout Columbine High School before committing suicide.
properties.Mental health - details: Harris was an alleged psychopath; Klebold was depressed and suicidal.
properties.Where obtained: Purchased variously at Tanner Gun Show in Denver, Colo. and from an individual
properties.Type of weapons: One semiautomatic handgun (assault), one rifle (assault), two shotguns
properties.Weapon details: 9mm Intratec DC-9 semiautomatic handgun; 9mm Hi-Point 995 carbine rifle; 12-gauge sawed-off Savage Stevens 311D, 12-gauge sawed-off Savage Springfield 67H pump-action shotguns
